ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours per week or less
2 (range: 0-8)
2 hours
~2 hours
Great class. Not too much work. Only several papers and no exams.
4-8 hrs
2-4 hours
2 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It was a good course, but the instructor did not seem too invested in it

Relatively interesting. Got very clinical at some points, depending on the guest speaker/topic being covered, which was not that great. I really appreciated when Dr. Lichtman lectured (though Dr. Mayne was also great).The assignments were minimal and we could probably learn more if they were slightly more intensive (just slightly!).
Great overview of heart disease epi.
I liked the course. found it helpful and enjoyable.
excellent course with evidence based information
Good. A very comprehensive overview of the heart attack and stroke epi.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  .

Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  I really like Dr. Lichtman. I was sometimes disappointed when she prioritized her grants over spending time in class - we set aside time to attend class and I hope she would be able to do so as well.When Dr. Lichtman lectured, I got the most out of lecture. Although she focuses quite a bit on her own work, that work is interesting, so it was good to hear about it!
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  She is a great professor and very knowledgeable in the subject.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  I enjoyed having Dr. Lichtman as my instructor.She's very knowledgeable and provided us with good paper to read.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Great professor! Very nice and great lecturer.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  very helpful
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Good. Very responsive.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Interesting topics covered and light work load
Recommend
A moderately interesting course covering a range of CVD/stroke issues. Extremely minimal workload. I would recommend only if a fellow student has a particular interest in CVD/stroke.
Great class, highly recommend.
Very interesting course, I encourage everyone to take the course
good course - I recommend it.
Great class to take if you have a busy course-load. Minimal commitment, but you learn a lot.
Very helpful if you want to follow future in cardiovascular and stroke medicine
Good. May be helpful for students who want to have a better understanding of heart attack and stroke
